page.title: 01SISLAND AND SURROUNDINGS
page.content: The parish of Sisland has 38 inhabitants. Mixed arable agriculture in family farms is the only industry the area has ever had. Cattle, pigs, chickens and turkeys are reared here and pheasants for shooting. The houses are large. Old farm buildings are too small for modern farm machinery and are either being converted to houses or being allowed to decay. New housing estates for Norwich commuters are appearing at the edges of the area. Hedges have largely disappeared. Small belts of trees are being planted. Half of the houses are not connected to mains water or sewer. All are connected to electricity. There is a victorian letter box in a barn wall. There are no shops. Grass grows in the middle of the roads and rubbish is dumped in a parish pit. Churches are used and well cared for.
